showScoreExcerpt:
"Considering that The Skin of Our Teeth is a very wordy play, complete with "news reels," extensive narration, and long speeches, it is notable that in this production, the visual aspect rules. ... What is lost in this spectacle is true emotional connection with the characters. The show is so wonderful that this fault almost doesn't matter. However, the ability to feel for and with the Antrobus family would push this extraordinary production into superlative territory."
